moves.1. e4 e5 2. f4: The King's Gambit. I was tempted to accept, but decided against it.
moves.2... f5: I was in a puckish mood and had never tried this move.
moves.3. Bc4: Luckily, he overlooked 3 Q-R5ch, or I could have been in trouble.
moves.4. Kf1: Very poor play on J.B.'s part, in retrospect. He probably should have played 3 Q-R5 ch himself on the previous move. Even here 4 P-N3 wouldn't leave me with much to do except retreat my Queen.
moves.4... Qxf4+: I go for the material grab.
moves.5. Ke1: It's just amazing how bad both he and I were at strategy back then. 5 N-B3 develops a piece and breaks the "attack".
moves.5... Bc5: With an obvious threat... at least I thought it was obvious. I didn't think he'd actually fall into it, but I figured I'd better start developing.
moves.6. Nc3: Development is always good. But you have to always make sure...
